message: What's the best database management system for android application if the database is on a server?

data.message: The fact that it's an android application doesn't make a difference, it all depends on what are you having there. Relational? Not relational? Scalable? Cheap? Huge community, small community? Takes a lot of resources, light? etc.
It's relational and yes it will take a lot of resources, so can I use for example MySql and connect it to my android app?
If you're not expecting a huge number of people, do that. It's better not to connect to the database directly, though. Create your own API.
OK got it. Thanks for the help.
I do not think there's nothing called  "The best" , it should depend on the case you are in , you can start small taking scaleability into consideration
You're right. Thanks for the help.

If it's on the server, it doesn't matter. You probably want to encapsulate your logic in a web service or something and do all your security and application-specific features in there. Then the Android app just talks to your service regardless of what DB is behind it.
